subject: Re: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?
msgSnippet: Hi Berin, if I got you right, you want TestCase to be an interface. One of the reasons is: ... I never had such problems due to TestCase being a class. Could
messageBody:
Hi Berin,

if I got you right, you want TestCase to be an interface. One of the
reasons is:

Berin Loritsch wrote:
> The reason being that sometimes the semantics and internals of the
> way TestCase is written gets in the way of how I want to make JUnit
> work in my environment.

I never had such problems due to TestCase being a class. Could you give an
example?

Yours

Johannes
